New Records: England won 3-0 against Bosnia and Herzegovina with a score of 0-0 at halftime.
England scored three goals in the last 10 minutes of the match.
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored a goal in the 89th minute.
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored a goal in the 85th minute.
Cole Palmer scored a penalty goal in the 60th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: England manager Gareth Southgate should not risk captain Harry Kane for the Three Lions' Euro 2024 warm-up friendly with Bosnia-Herzegovina at St James' Park on Monday evening.
Aston Villa talisman Ollie Watkins should hold off Ivan Toney to lead the line on Monday night.
Post-Match Reflections: The England boss has confirmed that Bukayo Saka will be rested ahead of Friday's tie with Iceland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at St. James' Park.
The match was a Euro 2024 warm-up friendly.
